intro: Isodon effusus f. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered isodon, is a botanical variant of the isodon genus. It is a perennial herb native to parts of East Asia, particularly China. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a soft, hairy texture. Its most distinguishing characteristic is the pale white to cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. This subspecies is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits and is also cultivated for ornamental purposes.
